pricing_text: Salesforce Sales Cloud starts at $25 per user, per month (billed monthly or annually), which is below the average SMB CRM software budget of $74. Pricing scales steeply across tiers, with advanced plans reaching $550 per user, per month (billed annually). There are no listed seat minimums, but feature depth varies significantly by tier.

HubSpot CRM is a free add-on tool, though access to essential features is restricted to paid subscriptions to HubSpot’s sales platform. Paid plans start at $20 per month for 2 users, or $240 billed annually, with additional users at $10 per user per month. This entry price is well below the $80 average SMB budget, but costs rise with user count and plan tier.

monday CRM starts at $12 per user per month when billed annually, or $15 per user per month on a monthly plan. This entry price is well below what most SMB budget for CRM software: $80 per user per month. monday CRM pricing scales with plan tier and team size, with advanced features like sales forecasting and lead scoring limited to higher-tier plans.

Dynamics 365 is billed annually across all plans and starts at $65 per user, per month for the Sales Professional plan, which sits at the upper end of the average small and midsize business (SMB) budget range of $35–$70 per user. Pricing scales by plan complexity and feature depth, with no public seat minimums listed.

Kylas Sales CRM starts at $250 per month for unlimited users, which is significantly lower than the average SMB budget of $74 per user, per month. Pricing is flat-rate and scales by record volume, not seat count, making it cost-efficient for growing teams. New users can start with a 7-day free trial or schedule a demo.
